triples.name: Machine learning
triples.relevance: The paper applies machine learning algorithms as the core methodology for predicting thyroid disease risk.

triples.name: Thyroid disease
triples.relevance: The paper addresses the task of predicting thyroid disease risk as the primary medical problem to solve.

triples.name: Artificial neural network
triples.relevance: The ANN Classifier is the best-performing algorithm identified by the paper with an F1-score of 0.957.

triples.name: F-score
triples.relevance: F1-score is the primary evaluation metric used by the paper to assess machine learning algorithm performance on unbalanced classification problems.

triples.name: Precision and recall
triples.relevance: The paper uses precision and recall metrics to evaluate the machine learning algorithms, with F1-score balancing both metrics.

triples.name: Statistical classification
triples.relevance: The paper performs statistical classification to categorize thyroid disease risk based on blood test data.

triples.name: Comparative analysis
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a systematic experimental comparative study of eleven machine learning algorithms to identify the best performer for thyroid disease prediction.
